intro: Phyllobolus tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered phyllobolus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to tropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with a spreading habit. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
